name: Fluphenazine Decanoate (Prolixin Decanoate)
summary: A long-acting injectable typical antipsychotic used in the maintenance treatment of schizophrenia and other psychotic disorders.
description: Fluphenazine decanoate is the long-acting injectable ester form of the high-potency typical antipsychotic fluphenazine. It is administered intramuscularly every 2–4 weeks for maintenance therapy in patients with schizophrenia or chronic psychotic disorders. This depot formulation improves adherence and ensures sustained therapeutic drug levels.

sections.text: Blocks postsynaptic dopamine D2 receptors in the mesolimbic pathway, reducing positive symptoms of psychosis; also antagonizes alpha-adrenergic and histamine receptors.

adult.titrate: Adjust in increments of 12.5 mg based on response

sections.geriatric: Use lower initial doses; monitor closely for EPS
sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; dose reduction may be required

sections.text: Onset within 48–96 hours; duration of action typically 2–4 weeks.

sections.black_box: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis.
other: Risk of EPS is higher with high-potency typical antipsychotics
Monitor for tardive dyskinesia with long-term use
Use with caution in cardiovascular disease

items: ECG if at risk for QT prolongation

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; use caution
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity to EPS and anticholinergic effects

sections.text: Gradual discontinuation recommended; monitor for relapse.

items: Depot formulation is used for maintenance after establishing oral fluphenazine tolerability
Higher potency means more EPS risk compared to low-potency agents

seo.title: Fluphenazine Decanoate (Prolixin Decanoate): Long-Acting Antipsychotic Dosing & Side Effects
seo.description: Fluphenazine Decanoate is a high-potency typical antipsychotic depot injection used for maintenance treatment of schizophrenia.
